name: DIY Black Tahini and Beet Hummus
description: Black tahini offers a sweeter, nuttier flavor than tahini made with white sesame seeds. With such black gold at my finger tips, I decided to add it to a hummus that could stand up to it, pigment-wise. The color alone is sure to turn a few heads at your next gathering.
recipeIngredient: 4 medium beets (about 8 ounces), roasted, peeled, and cubed
1 teaspoon cumin seed, toasted and ground
4 tablespoons olive oil, plus additional as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine beets, chickpeas, cumin, tahini, lemon juice, vinegar, and garlic in the bowl of a food processor. Process until smooth. With machine running, slowly drizzle in olive oil. Season with salt to taste. Serve, drizzling with extra olive oil and sprinkling with parsley.
